meanings.definition: Moving unsteadily or with a staggered gait.
meanings.sent1: The old man's staggery steps showed his difficulty in walking.
meanings.sent2: The toddler's staggery walk made everyone smile.
meanings.sent3: The staggery dance moves of the penguin entertained the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The ship's staggery progress through the stormy sea was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The staggery movements of the robot made it seem almost human.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a series of staggers or lurches.
meanings.sent1: The staggery movements of the broken toy were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The staggery ride on the old rollercoaster was thrilling.
meanings.sent3: The staggery flight of the butterfly caught the children's attention.
meanings.sent4: The staggery progress of the snail was a lesson in patience.
meanings.sent5: The staggery motion of the car on the bumpy road made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of dizziness or unsteadiness.
meanings.sent1: The staggery ride on the spinning teacups made her feel queasy.
meanings.sent2: The staggery boat ride left them feeling disoriented.
meanings.sent3: The staggery elevator descent made everyone giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The staggery camera movement in the movie scene added to the suspense.
meanings.sent5: The staggery bridge crossing made her hold onto the railing tightly.
